site_name: Land At Old Oak Common Including Hythe Road, The Grand Union Canal, Salter Street And Station Approach, Railway Lines And Land, Partly Bounded By Railway Lines To The West And Scrubs Lane To The East
description: Request for an Environmental Impact Assessment Scoping Opinion in accordance with Regulation 13 of the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) (England) Regulations 2011 (as amended) in association with a development comprising: Between 6,200-6,700 new dwellings (Use Class C3); Up to 30,000 m2 residential institutions (C2), including student (up to 1,000 beds) and hotel (up to 150 beds); Up to 57,000 m2 commercial space (Use Classes B1 to B8); Up to 42,000 m2 of 'flip Plot' floorspace (commercial use Class B1 or Residential use Class C3); Up to 35,000 m2 retail and leisure (Use Classes A1 to A5, D2; Up to 12,000 m2 community uses which include education and healthcare uses (Use D1); Up to 47,000 m2 cultural uses (Use D1); Sui generis uses; Meanwhile uses such as temporary public open space, storage/warehousing and/or car parking; Associated infrastructure, including a new vehicular accesses and pedestrian access bridge from Scrubs Lane; A new railway station (Hythe Road Station) with an associated viaduct; Streets, open spaces, public realm, and landscaping; A new pedestrian bridge link to Willesden Junction; Car, cycle and motorbike parking spaces and servicing; Utilities including energy centre(s) and substation(s); Other works incidental to the Development; New bridge linkages points from the Site over the Grand Union Canal
